content: I am somewhat at a loss when trying to figure out how to create an implementation guide. All my profiles are complete but this part seems very vague; especially the creation of 'pages'. It looks like a bunch of links to free-form anything. That being said, there is an Implementation Guide editior in Forge and Simplifier. Simplifier uses markdown so I thought it would be easier to use Forge. But after creating the Forge guide (putting in all the concrete items but no 'free-form' material), Simplifier gave me this message on an upload "resource cannot be rendered". Are the implementation guides produced by Forge and Simplifier incompatible?

Hi @Brian Reinhold, correct, IG support is preliminary and currently under active development.

Forge allows you to author a FHIR IG resource. This was mainly implemented to allow users to open/save a set of related resources as an IG package. You cannot author actual IG content pages from within Forge.

Simplifier currently provides an online IG editor (in beta). The editor allows you to author and publish actual page content and embed profile renderings. We are currently working on improving this functionality, e.g. allowing you to import/export actual FHIR IG resources and markdown pages. However these new features are currently being developed and not yet available. We're planning to start releasing new IG features on Simplifier later this summer. Stay tuned!

@Michel Rutten On Simplifier it states that one can create an implementation guide by

You can access the IG editor via the Portal in your Simplifier account. To get there, log in to Simplifier and select the Implementation Guides tab from your Portal page.

However, I could not find this 'Portal' in Simplifier. How do I get to the Portal?
Thanks
Hi @Brian Reinhold, the online IG editor in Simplifier is currently only available on paid accounts. We will update the documentation to mention this.
